title: Launch folder from a StorageFile
body: Launcher.LaunchFolderAsync should accept a StorageFile as first argument. Sometimes I only have a StorageFile and I would like to launch the Explorer to display that file. To do so, I need access to the file's StorageFolder and pass that to LaunchFolderAsync. However, I usually don't have the permission to access the StorageFolder and StorageFile.GetParentAsync() returns null.
